title: 820-2915 12V dropping issue.
message:
HI
Im working on a 2915 that had heavy liquid damaged, ive done a lot of rework, Ive got it to the point where it chimes and remains on in SMC bypass.

Now when its not in SMC bypass the system does spin the fans, but only when 12V is high, it often drops to about 3V then goes back to  12V. It seems like the SMC is turning the ISL6259 off for some reason. 
Ive already replaced the ISL6259, The SMC, check all current sensing around the ISL6259.ect and have had no symtom changes atall.

Any help would be appreciated.

title: 820-2915 12V dropping issue.
message: Must be an issue with current sense circuits. Check R7021/22/51/52 and traces.

title: 820-2915 12V dropping issue.
message: As stated above i have checked the ISL's current sensing. They are all correct. ive had a look at it under the micrsocope, all the traces are intact.

title: 820-2915 12V dropping issue.
message: also 12V often peaks at 13.2 witch is iffy at best.

title: 820-2915 12V dropping issue.
message: Could you measure resistance between pin 17/18 and between pin 27/28 and report values please???

title: 820-2915 12V dropping issue.
message:
Thanks duke, there was a tiny trace break on pin 17. Dont usualy miss things like that. 

Typically this board is still a pain in the ass. Its now posting but with a messed up screen, It boots though, im fairly sure the GMUX has failed. Just my luck.
